subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}}. Multiple interpretations:
* A sacrificial vessel used for chopping and holding meat, as viewed from above ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1923}}) – original form of {{och-l|俎}}.
* An erect penis, the symbol of the male ancestor ({{zh-ref|Guo, 1931}}) – original form of {{och-l|祖}}.
* A stone altar – original form of {{och-l|祖}}.

In the oracle bones and bronze inscriptions, this character was commonly used as {{och-l|祖}}. Usage as {{och-l|俎}} is not attested until the Warring States period in the bamboo script.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “and; also; almost; be going to”
: Cognate with {{och-l|將}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
